newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RESEARCH ALERT - Petroz rated a "buy".
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Petroz rated a "buy".

text.p: Broker Wilson HTM Ltd said it had recommended Petroz NL as a buy investment based on the oil and gas explorer's participation in the Timor Sea's potentially-rich oil exploration programme.

"Buy Petroz. The recent Kakatua North discovery confirms our view the potential for further oil discoveries in ZOCA 91-12 is under-rated," Wilson's resources research director Phil Hutchings said in a report.
"There are a number of other prospective structures nearby which we believe will ultimately result in oil production well beyond the four to five years currently envisaged," Hutchings said.
Hutchings said the company's estimated nine percent share of the Bayu-Undan gas condensate field in ZOCA 91-12 was due for a revaluation. The ZOCA permits are shared between Australia and Indonesia.
"Our valuation places a value on all Petroz' assets, including exploration assets and cash, of between A$1.15 and $1.45 per share," he said.
Hutchings said of this, the nine percent in Bayu Undan was valued at between A$90 million and $120 million, or between 45 cents and 61 cents per share.
Hutchings forecast Petroz net profit for the current year ended June 30, 1997 to be A$4 million compared with a net profit of $6.3 million in the 1995/96 year.
Petroz' share price was A$1.11 when the report was prepared and was five cents lower at A$1.08 at the end of Tuesday morning trade.
